options.text: It was a cause of the unequal distribution of land

options.label: D

options.text: They were able to work on European-owned property as migrant laborers and miners

multiple-choice.question: What is the current status of the released Takhi horses?

options.label: A
options.text: They are completely wild and free.

options.label: B
options.text: They are closely monitored and controlled for their own protection.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main cause of animal extinctions today?

options.label: A
options.text: Habitat loss due to human activities.

multiple-choice.question: What should zoos do to truly help protect the diversity of animal life on this planet?

options.label: A
options.text: Continue to breed animals in captivity.

options.label: B
options.text: Focus on preserving the natural habitats of animals.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main theme of the story of the Takhi horse?

options.label: A
options.text: The importance of zoos in conservation.

options.label: B
options.text: The complexity of conservation efforts to save endangered species.

options.label: C
options.text: The extinction of the Takhi horse.

title: The surprising secret to a healthier gut - Kathryn M. Stephenson and David L. Suskind

multiple-choice.question: What unusual ingredient in Ge Hong's special soup could cure diarrhea-stricken patients?
What term refers to the trillions of bacteria, viruses, fungi, and archaea that live in the human gut?
What are some primary functions of the gut microbiome in the human body?

options.label: A
options.text: To break down food and make vitamins

options.label: B
options.text: To train the immune system and circadian rhythm

options.label: C
options.text: To protect the body from infections

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the treatment that involves infusing a new batch of microorganisms into the intestine?
What is the primary purpose of fecal microbial transplantation?

options.label: A
options.text: To treat antibiotic-resistant Clostridiodes difficile infections

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary source of feces for fecal microbial transplantation?
What is the acceptance rate of one prominent stool bank?
What is a common method of administration for fecal microbial transplantation?

options.label: B
options.text: Tube into the stomach or colon

multiple-choice.question: What is the effectiveness rate of fecal microbial transplantation in treating antibiotic-resistant Clostridiodes difficile infections?
What are some potential future uses of fecal bacteriotherapy?

options.label: A
options.text: To treat only antibiotic-resistant Clostridiodes difficile infections

options.label: B
options.text: To treat multiple diseases, including type 2 diabetes, anxiety, and depression
